member.summary: An extracted segment of the text that is an attribute of an entity, or otherwise related to an entity, such as the dosage of a medication taken. It contains information about the attribute such as id, begin and end offset within the input text, and the segment of the input text.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.ComprehendMedicalAsyncJobFilter.SubmitTimeAfter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SubmitTimeAfter.
Filters the list of jobs based on the time that the job was submitted for processing. Returns only jobs submitted after the specified time. Jobs are returned in descending order, newest to oldest.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.ComprehendMedicalAsyncJobFilter.SubmitTimeBefore
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SubmitTimeBefore.
Filters the list of jobs based on the time that the job was submitted for processing. Returns only jobs submitted before the specified time. Jobs are returned in ascending order, oldest to newest.

member.name: T:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.DetectEntitiesRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DetectEntities operation. The DetectEntities operation is deprecated. You should use the DetectEntitiesV2 operation instead.
Inspects the clinical text for a variety of medical entities and returns specific information about them such as entity category, location, and confidence score on that information .

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.DetectEntitiesRequest.Text
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Text.
A UTF-8 text string containing the clinical content being examined for entities. Each string must contain fewer than 20,000 bytes of characters.

member.name: T:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.DetectEntitiesResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DetectEntities operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.DetectEntitiesResponse.Entities
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Entities.
The collection of medical entities extracted from the input text and their associated information. For each entity, the response provides the entity text, the entity category, where the entity text begins and ends, and the level of confidence that Amazon Comprehend Medical has in the detection and analysis. Attributes and traits of the entity are also returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.DetectEntitiesResponse.ModelVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ModelVersion.
The version of the model used to analyze the documents. The version number looks like X.X.X. You can use this information to track the model used for a particular batch of documents.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.DetectEntitiesResponse.PaginationToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PaginationToken.
If the result of the previous request to DetectEntities was truncated, include the PaginationToken to fetch the next page of entities.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.DetectEntitiesResponse.UnmappedAttributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UnmappedAttributes.
Attributes extracted from the input text that we were unable to relate to an entity.

member.name: T:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.DetectEntitiesV2Request
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DetectEntitiesV2 operation. Inspects the clinical text for a variety of medical entities and returns specific information about them such as entity category, location, and confidence score on that information. Amazon Comprehend Medical only detects medical entities in English language texts.
The DetectEntitiesV2 operation replaces the DetectEntities operation. This new action uses a different model for determining the entities in your medical text and changes the way that some entities are returned in the output. You should use the DetectEntitiesV2 operation in all new applications.
The DetectEntitiesV2 operation returns the Acuity and Direction entities as attributes instead of types.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.DetectEntitiesV2Request.Text
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Text.
A UTF-8 string containing the clinical content being examined for entities. Each string must contain fewer than 20,000 bytes of characters.

member.name: T:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.DetectEntitiesV2Response
member.summary: This is the response object from the DetectEntitiesV2 operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.DetectEntitiesV2Response.Entities
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Entities.
The collection of medical entities extracted from the input text and their associated information. For each entity, the response provides the entity text, the entity category, where the entity text begins and ends, and the level of confidence in the detection and analysis. Attributes and traits of the entity are also returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.DetectEntitiesV2Response.ModelVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ModelVersion.
The version of the model used to analyze the documents. The version number looks like X.X.X. You can use this information to track the model used for a particular batch of documents.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.DetectEntitiesV2Response.PaginationToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PaginationToken.
If the result to the DetectEntitiesV2 operation was truncated, include the PaginationToken to fetch the next page of entities.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.DetectEntitiesV2Response.UnmappedAttributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UnmappedAttributes.
Attributes extracted from the input text that couldn't be related to an entity.

member.name: T:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.DetectPHIRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DetectPHI operation. Inspects the clinical text for protected health information (PHI) entities and returns the entity category, location, and confidence score for each entity. Amazon Comprehend Medical only detects entities in English language texts.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.DetectPHIRequest.Text
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Text.
A UTF-8 text string containing the clinical content being examined for PHI entities. Each string must contain fewer than 20,000 bytes of characters.

member.name: T:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.DetectPHIResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DetectPHI operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.DetectPHIResponse.Entities
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Entities.
The collection of PHI entities extracted from the input text and their associated information. For each entity, the response provides the entity text, the entity category, where the entity text begins and ends, and the level of confidence that Amazon Comprehend Medical has in its detection.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.DetectPHIResponse.ModelVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ModelVersion.
The version of the model used to analyze the documents. The version number looks like X.X.X. You can use this information to track the model used for a particular batch of documents.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.DetectPHIResponse.PaginationToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PaginationToken.
If the result of the previous request to DetectPHI was truncated, include the PaginationToken to fetch the next page of PHI entities.

member.name: T:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.InferICD10CMRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the InferICD10CM operation. InferICD10CM detects medical conditions as entities listed in a patient record and links those entities to normalized concept identifiers in the ICD-10-CM knowledge base from the Centers for Disease Control. Amazon Comprehend Medical only detects medical entities in English language texts.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.InferICD10CMRequest.Text
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Text.
The input text used for analysis. The input for InferICD10CM is a string from 1 to 10000 characters.

member.summary: This is the response object from the InferICD10CM operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.InferICD10CMResponse.Entities
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Entities.
The medical conditions detected in the text linked to ICD-10-CM concepts. If the action is successful, the service sends back an HTTP 200 response, as well as the entities detected.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.InferICD10CMResponse.ModelVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ModelVersion.
The version of the model used to analyze the documents, in the format n.n.n You can use this information to track the model used for a particular batch of documents.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.InferICD10CMResponse.PaginationToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PaginationToken.
If the result of the previous request to InferICD10CM was truncated, include the PaginationToken to fetch the next page of medical condition entities.

member.name: T:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.InferRxNormRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the InferRxNorm operation. InferRxNorm detects medications as entities listed in a patient record and links to the normalized concept identifiers in the RxNorm database from the National Library of Medicine. Amazon Comprehend Medical only detects medical entities in English language texts.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.InferRxNormRequest.Text
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Text.
The input text used for analysis. The input for InferRxNorm is a string from 1 to 10000 characters.

member.name: T:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.InferRxNormResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the InferRxNorm operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.InferRxNormResponse.Entities
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Entities.
The medication entities detected in the text linked to RxNorm concepts. If the action is successful, the service sends back an HTTP 200 response, as well as the entities detected.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.InferRxNormResponse.ModelVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ModelVersion.
The version of the model used to analyze the documents, in the format n.n.n You can use this information to track the model used for a particular batch of documents.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.InferRxNormResponse.PaginationToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PaginationToken.
If the result of the previous request to InferRxNorm was truncated, include the PaginationToken to fetch the next page of medication entities.

member.name: T:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.InputDataConfig
member.summary: The input properties for an entities detection job. This includes the name of the S3 bucket and the path to the files to be analyzed.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.InputDataConfig.S3Bucket
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3Bucket.
The URI of the S3 bucket that contains the input data. The bucket must be in the same region as the API endpoint that you are calling.
Each file in the document collection must be less than 40 KB. You can store a maximum of 30 GB in the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.InputDataConfig.S3Key
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3Key.
The path to the input data files in the S3 bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.OutputDataConfig.S3Bucket
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3Bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.OutputDataConfig.S3Key
member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.RxNormAttribute
member.summary: The extracted attributes that relate to this entity. The attributes recognized by InferRxNorm are DOSAGE, DURATION, FORM, FREQUENCY, RATE, ROUTE_OR_MODE.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.RxNormAttribute.BeginOffset
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BeginOffset.
The 0-based character offset in the input text that shows where the attribute begins. The offset returns the UTF-8 code point in the string.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.RxNormAttribute.EndOffset
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndOffset.
The 0-based character offset in the input text that shows where the attribute ends. The offset returns the UTF-8 code point in the string.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.RxNormAttribute.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The numeric identifier for this attribute. This is a monotonically increasing id unique within this response rather than a global unique identifier.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.RxNormAttribute.RelationshipScore
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RelationshipScore.
The level of confidence that Amazon Comprehend Medical has that the attribute is accurately linked to an entity.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.RxNormAttribute.Score
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Score.
The level of confidence that Comprehend Medical has that the segment of text is correctly recognized as an attribute.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.RxNormAttribute.Text
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Text.
The segment of input text which corresponds to the detected attribute.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.RxNormAttribute.Traits
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Traits.
Contextual information for the attribute. InferRxNorm recognizes the trait NEGATION for attributes, i.e. that the patient is not taking a specific dose or form of a medication.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.RxNormAttribute.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The type of attribute. The types of attributes recognized by InferRxNorm are BRAND_NAME and GENERIC_NAME.

member.name: T:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.RxNormConcept
member.summary: The RxNorm concept that the entity could refer to, along with a score indicating the likelihood of the match.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.RxNormConcept.Code
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Code.
RxNorm concept ID, also known as the RxCUI.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.RxNormConcept.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
The description of the RxNorm concept.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.RxNormConcept.Score
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Score.
The level of confidence that Amazon Comprehend Medical has that the entity is accurately linked to the reported RxNorm concept.

member.name: T:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.RxNormEntity
member.summary: The collection of medical entities extracted from the input text and their associated information. For each entity, the response provides the entity text, the entity category, where the entity text begins and ends, and the level of confidence that Amazon Comprehend Medical has in the detection and analysis. Attributes and traits of the entity are also returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.RxNormEntity.Attributes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Attributes.
The extracted attributes that relate to the entity. The attributes recognized by InferRxNorm are DOSAGE, DURATION, FORM, FREQUENCY, RATE, ROUTE_OR_MODE, and STRENGTH.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.RxNormEntity.BeginOffset
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BeginOffset.
The 0-based character offset in the input text that shows where the entity begins. The offset returns the UTF-8 code point in the string.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.RxNormEntity.Category
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Category.
The category of the entity. The recognized categories are GENERIC or BRAND_NAME.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.RxNormEntity.EndOffset
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndOffset.
The 0-based character offset in the input text that shows where the entity ends. The offset returns the UTF-8 code point in the string.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.RxNormEntity.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The numeric identifier for the entity. This is a monotonically increasing id unique within this response rather than a global unique identifier.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.RxNormEntity.RxNormConcepts
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RxNormConcepts.
The RxNorm concepts that the entity could refer to, along with a score indicating the likelihood of the match.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.RxNormEntity.Score
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Score.
The level of confidence that Amazon Comprehend Medical has in the accuracy of the detected entity.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.RxNormEntity.Text
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Text.
The segment of input text extracted from which the entity was detected.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.RxNormEntity.Traits
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Traits.
Contextual information for the entity.

member.name: P:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.RxNormEntity.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
Describes the specific type of entity. For InferRxNorm, the recognized entity type is MEDICATION.

member.name: T:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.RxNormTrait
member.summary: The contextual information for the entity. InferRxNorm recognizes the trait NEGATION, which is any indication that the patient is not taking a medication.

member.summary:

The level of confidence that Amazon Comprehend Medical has in the accuracy of the detected trait.

member.name: T:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.AmazonComprehendMedicalClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing ComprehendMedical
Amazon Comprehend Medical extracts structured information from unstructured clinical text. Use these actions to gain insight in your documents.

member.name: M:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.AmazonComprehendMedicalClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonComprehendMedicalClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.AmazonComprehendMedicalClient.DetectEntitiesV2(Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.DetectEntitiesV2Request)
member.summary:
Inspects the clinical text for a variety of medical entities and returns specific information about them such as entity category, location, and confidence score on that information. Amazon Comprehend Medical only detects medical entities in English language texts.
The DetectEntitiesV2 operation replaces the DetectEntities operation. This new action uses a different model for determining the entities in your medical text and changes the way that some entities are returned in the output. You should use the DetectEntitiesV2 operation in all new applications.
The DetectEntitiesV2 operation returns the Acuity and Direction entities as attributes instead of types.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DetectEntitiesV2 service method.
member.returns: The response from the DetectEntitiesV2 service method, as returned by ComprehendMedical.

member.name: M:Amazon.ComprehendMedical.IAmazonComprehendMedical.DetectEntitiesV2(Amazon.ComprehendMedical.Model.DetectEntitiesV2Request)
member.summary:
Inspects the clinical text for a variety of medical entities and returns specific information about them such as entity category, location, and confidence score on that information. Amazon Comprehend Medical only detects medical entities in English language texts.
The DetectEntitiesV2 operation replaces the DetectEntities operation. This new action uses a different model for determining the entities in your medical text and changes the way that some entities are returned in the output. You should use the DetectEntitiesV2 operation in all new applications.
The DetectEntitiesV2 operation returns the Acuity and Direction entities as attributes instead of types.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DetectEntitiesV2 service method.
member.returns: The response from the DetectEntitiesV2 service method, as returned by ComprehendMedical.
